get.description:
Useful when you have a self-referring ManyToManyRelationship.
* Tower uses a shallow (2-deep only) url pattern. For example:

When an object hangs off of a parent object you would have the url of the
form /api/v2/parent_model/34/child_model. If you then wanted a child of the
child model you would NOT do /api/v2/parent_model/34/child_model/87/child_child_model
Instead, you would access the child_child_model via /api/v2/child_child_model/87/
and you would create child_child_model's off of /api/v2/child_model/87/child_child_model_set
Now, when creating child_child_model related to child_model you still want to
link child_child_model to parent_model. That's what this class is for

get.description:
Useful when you have a self-referring ManyToManyRelationship.
* Tower uses a shallow (2-deep only) url pattern. For example:

When an object hangs off of a parent object you would have the url of the
form /api/v2/parent_model/34/child_model. If you then wanted a child of the
child model you would NOT do /api/v2/parent_model/34/child_model/87/child_child_model
Instead, you would access the child_child_model via /api/v2/child_child_model/87/
and you would create child_child_model's off of /api/v2/child_model/87/child_child_model_set
Now, when creating child_child_model related to child_model you still want to
link child_child_model to parent_model. That's what this class is for

Use this endpoint to give a team permission to a resource or an organization.
The needed data is the team, the role definition, and the object id.
The object must be of the type specified in the role definition.
The type given in the role definition and the provided object_id are used
to look up the resource.

After creation, the assignment cannot be edited, but can be deleted to
remove those permissions.

total_groups.description: This field is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Total number of groups in this inventory.

enabled_var.description: Retrieve the enabled state from the given dict of host variables. The enabled variable may be specified as "foo.bar", in which case the lookup will traverse into nested dicts, equivalent to: from_dict.get("foo", {}).get("bar", default)

enabled_value.description: Only used when enabled_var is set. Value when the host is considered enabled. For example if enabled_var="status.power_state"and enabled_value="powered_on" with host variables:{   "status": {     "power_state": "powered_on",     "created": "2020-08-04T18:13:04+00:00",     "healthy": true    },    "name": "foobar",    "ip_address": "192.168.2.1"}The host would be marked enabled. If power_state where any value other than powered_on then the host would be disabled when imported. If the key is not found then the host will be enabled

use_fact_cache.description: If enabled, the service will act as an Ansible Fact Cache Plugin; persisting facts at the end of a playbook run to the database and caching facts for use by Ansible.

execution_environment.description: The container image to be used for execution.

diff_mode.description: If enabled, textual changes made to any templated files on the host are shown in the standard output

job_slice_count.description: The number of jobs to slice into at runtime. Will cause the Job Template to launch a workflow if value is greater than 1.

* `github` - GitHub
* `gitlab` - GitLab
* `bitbucket_dc` - BitBucket DataCenter

webhook_credential.description: Personal Access Token for posting back the status to the service API

prevent_instance_group_fallback.description: If enabled, the job template will prevent adding any inventory or organization instance groups to the list of preferred instances groups to run on.If this setting is enabled and you provided an empty list, the global instance groups will be applied.

opa_query_path.description: The query path for the OPA policy to evaluate prior to job execution. The query path should be formatted as package/rule.

organization.description: Organization this label belongs to.

messages.description: Optional custom messages for notification template.

max_hosts.description: Maximum number of hosts allowed to be managed by this organization.

default_environment.description: The default execution environment for jobs run by this organization.

opa_query_path.description: The query path for the OPA policy to evaluate prior to job execution. The query path should be formatted as package/rule.

local_path.description: Local path (relative to PROJECTS_ROOT) containing playbooks and related files for this project.

Specifies the source control system used to store the project.

is_partially_migrated.description: A flag indicating that the resource has been copied into the resource server, but the service_id hasn't been updated yet.

ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED.title: Enable Activity Stream
ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED.description: Enable capturing activity for the activity stream.

ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED_FOR_INVENTORY_SY.title: Enable Activity Stream for Inventory Sync
ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED_FOR_INVENTORY_SY.description: Enable capturing activity for the activity stream when running inventory sync.

ORG_ADMINS_CAN_SEE_ALL_USERS.title: All Users Visible to Organization Admins
ORG_ADMINS_CAN_SEE_ALL_USERS.description: Controls whether any Organization Admin can view all users and teams, even those not associated with their Organization.

MANAGE_ORGANIZATION_AUTH.title: Organization Admins Can Manage Users and Teams
MANAGE_ORGANIZATION_AUTH.description: Controls whether any Organization Admin has the privileges to create and manage users and teams.

TOWER_URL_BASE.title: Base URL of the service
TOWER_URL_BASE.description: This setting is used by services like notifications to render a valid url to the service.

REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS.description: HTTP headers and meta keys to search to determine remote host name or IP. Add additional items to this list, such as "HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR", if behind a reverse proxy. See the "Proxy Support" section of the AAP Installation guide for more details.

PROXY_IP_ALLOWED_LIST.description: If the service is behind a reverse proxy/load balancer, use this setting to configure the proxy IP addresses from which the service should trust custom REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS header values. If this setting is an empty list (the default), the headers specified by REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS will be trusted unconditionally')

CSRF_TRUSTED_ORIGINS.title: CSRF Trusted Origins List
CSRF_TRUSTED_ORIGINS.description: If the service is behind a reverse proxy/load balancer, use this setting to configure the schema://addresses from which the service should trust Origin header values.

REDHAT_USERNAME.title: Red Hat Client ID for Analytics
REDHAT_USERNAME.description: Client ID used to send data to Automation Analytics

REDHAT_PASSWORD.title: Red Hat Client Secret for Analytics
REDHAT_PASSWORD.description: Client secret used to send data to Automation Analytics

SUBSCRIPTIONS_USERNAME.title: Red Hat Username for Subscriptions
SUBSCRIPTIONS_USERNAME.description: Username used to retrieve subscription and content information

SUBSCRIPTIONS_PASSWORD.title: Red Hat Password for Subscriptions
SUBSCRIPTIONS_PASSWORD.description: Password used to retrieve subscription and content information

SUBSCRIPTIONS_CLIENT_ID.title: Red Hat Client ID for Subscriptions
SUBSCRIPTIONS_CLIENT_ID.description: Client ID used to retrieve subscription and content information

SUBSCRIPTIONS_CLIENT_SECRET.title: Red Hat Client Secret for Subscriptions
SUBSCRIPTIONS_CLIENT_SECRET.description: Client secret used to retrieve subscription and content information

AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_URL.title: Automation Analytics upload URL
AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_URL.description: This setting is used to to configure the upload URL for data collection for Automation Analytics.

DEFAULT_EXECUTION_ENVIRONMENT.title: Global default execution environment
DEFAULT_EXECUTION_ENVIRONMENT.description: The Execution Environment to be used when one has not been configured for a job template.

CUSTOM_VENV_PATHS.title: Custom virtual environment paths
CUSTOM_VENV_PATHS.description: Paths where Tower will look for custom virtual environments (in addition to /var/lib/awx/venv/). Enter one path per line.

AD_HOC_COMMANDS.title: Ansible Modules Allowed for Ad Hoc Jobs
AD_HOC_COMMANDS.description: List of modules allowed to be used by ad-hoc jobs.

ALLOW_JINJA_IN_EXTRA_VARS.title: When can extra variables contain Jinja templates?
ALLOW_JINJA_IN_EXTRA_VARS.description:
Ansible allows variable substitution via the Jinja2 templating language for --extra-vars. This poses a potential security risk where users with the ability to specify extra vars at job launch time can use Jinja2 templates to run arbitrary Python.  It is recommended that this value be set to "template" or "never".

* `always` - Always
* `never` - Never
* `template` - Only On Job Template Definitions

AWX_ISOLATION_BASE_PATH.title: Job execution path
AWX_ISOLATION_BASE_PATH.description: The directory in which the service will create new temporary directories for job execution and isolation (such as credential files).

AWX_ISOLATION_SHOW_PATHS.title: Paths to expose to isolated jobs
AWX_ISOLATION_SHOW_PATHS.description: List of paths that would otherwise be hidden to expose to isolated jobs. Enter one path per line. Volumes will be mounted from the execution node to the container. The supported format is HOST-DIR[:CONTAINER-DIR[:OPTIONS]].

AWX_TASK_ENV.title: Extra Environment Variables
AWX_TASK_ENV.description: Additional environment variables set for playbook runs, inventory updates, project updates, and notification sending.

AWX_RUNNER_KEEPALIVE_SECONDS.title: K8S Ansible Runner Keep-Alive Message Interval
AWX_RUNNER_KEEPALIVE_SECONDS.description: Only applies to jobs running in a Container Group. If not 0, send a message every so-many seconds to keep connection open.

GALAXY_TASK_ENV.title: Environment Variables for Galaxy Commands
GALAXY_TASK_ENV.description: Additional environment variables set for invocations of ansible-galaxy within project updates. Useful if you must use a proxy server for ansible-galaxy but not git.

INSIGHTS_TRACKING_STATE.title: Gather data for Automation Analytics
INSIGHTS_TRACKING_STATE.description: Enables the service to gather data on automation and send it to Automation Analytics.

PROJECT_UPDATE_VVV.title: Run Project Updates With Higher Verbosity
PROJECT_UPDATE_VVV.description: Adds the CLI -vvv flag to ansible-playbook runs of project_update.yml used for project updates.

AWX_ROLES_ENABLED.title: Enable Role Download
AWX_ROLES_ENABLED.description: Allows roles to be dynamically downloaded from a requirements.yml file for SCM projects.

AWX_COLLECTIONS_ENABLED.title: Enable Collection(s) Download
AWX_COLLECTIONS_ENABLED.description: Allows collections to be dynamically downloaded from a requirements.yml file for SCM projects.

AWX_SHOW_PLAYBOOK_LINKS.title: Follow symlinks
AWX_SHOW_PLAYBOOK_LINKS.description: Follow symbolic links when scanning for playbooks. Be aware that setting this to True can lead to infinite recursion if a link points to a parent directory of itself.

AWX_MOUNT_ISOLATED_PATHS_ON_K8S.title: Expose host paths for Container Groups
AWX_MOUNT_ISOLATED_PATHS_ON_K8S.description: Expose paths via hostPath for the Pods created by a Container Group. HostPath volumes present many security risks, and it is a best practice to avoid the use of HostPaths when possible.

GALAXY_IGNORE_CERTS.title: Ignore Ansible Galaxy SSL Certificate Verification
GALAXY_IGNORE_CERTS.description: If set to true, certificate validation will not be done when installing content from any Galaxy server.

STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.title: Standard Output Maximum Display Size
STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.description: Maximum Size of Standard Output in bytes to display before requiring the output be downloaded.

EVENT_STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.title: Job Event Standard Output Maximum Display Size
EVENT_STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.description: Maximum Size of Standard Output in bytes to display for a single job or ad hoc command event. `stdout` will end with `` when truncated.

MAX_WEBSOCKET_EVENT_RATE.title: Job Event Maximum Websocket Messages Per Second
MAX_WEBSOCKET_EVENT_RATE.description: Maximum number of messages to update the UI live job output with per second. Value of 0 means no limit.

SCHEDULE_MAX_JOBS.title: Maximum Scheduled Jobs
SCHEDULE_MAX_JOBS.description: Maximum number of the same job template that can be waiting to run when launching from a schedule before no more are created.

AWX_ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS.title: Ansible Callback Plugins
AWX_ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS.description: List of paths to search for extra callback plugins to be used when running jobs. Enter one path per line.

DEFAULT_JOB_TIMEOUT.description: Maximum time in seconds to allow jobs to run. Use value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed. A timeout set on an individual job template will override this.

DEFAULT_JOB_IDLE_TIMEOUT.description: If no output is detected from ansible in this number of seconds the execution will be terminated. Use value of 0 to indicate that no idle timeout should be imposed.

DEFAULT_INVENTORY_UPDATE_TIMEOUT.description: Maximum time in seconds to allow inventory updates to run. Use value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed. A timeout set on an individual inventory source will override this.

DEFAULT_PROJECT_UPDATE_TIMEOUT.description: Maximum time in seconds to allow project updates to run. Use value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed. A timeout set on an individual project will override this.

ANSIBLE_FACT_CACHE_TIMEOUT.title: Per-Host Ansible Fact Cache Timeout
ANSIBLE_FACT_CACHE_TIMEOUT.description: Maximum time, in seconds, that stored Ansible facts are considered valid since the last time they were modified. Only valid, non-stale, facts will be accessible by a playbook. Note, this does not influence the deletion of ansible_facts from the database. Use a value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed.

MAX_FORKS.title: Maximum number of forks per job
MAX_FORKS.description: Saving a Job Template with more than this number of forks will result in an error. When set to 0, no limit is applied.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_HOST.title: Logging Aggregator
LOG_AGGREGATOR_HOST.description: Hostname/IP where external logs will be sent to.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_PORT.title: Logging Aggregator Port
LOG_AGGREGATOR_PORT.description: Port on Logging Aggregator to send logs to (if required and not provided in Logging Aggregator).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_TYPE.title: Logging Aggregator Type
LOG_AGGREGATOR_TYPE.description:
Format messages for the chosen log aggregator.

* `logstash` - logstash
* `splunk` - splunk
* `loggly` - loggly
* `sumologic` - sumologic
* `other` - other

LOG_AGGREGATOR_USERNAME.title: Logging Aggregator Username
LOG_AGGREGATOR_USERNAME.description: Username for external log aggregator (if required; HTTP/s only).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_PASSWORD.title: Logging Aggregator Password/Token
LOG_AGGREGATOR_PASSWORD.description: Password or authentication token for external log aggregator (if required; HTTP/s only).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_LOGGERS.title: Loggers Sending Data to Log Aggregator Form
LOG_AGGREGATOR_LOGGERS.description:
List of loggers that will send HTTP logs to the collector, these can include any or all of: 
awx - service logs
activity_stream - activity stream records
job_events - callback data from Ansible job events
system_tracking - facts gathered from scan jobs
broadcast_websocket - errors pertaining to websockets broadcast metrics
job_lifecycle - logs related to processing of a job

LOG_AGGREGATOR_INDIVIDUAL_FACTS.title: Log System Tracking Facts Individually
LOG_AGGREGATOR_INDIVIDUAL_FACTS.description: If set, system tracking facts will be sent for each package, service, or other item found in a scan, allowing for greater search query granularity. If unset, facts will be sent as a single dictionary, allowing for greater efficiency in fact processing.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_ENABLED.title: Enable External Logging
LOG_AGGREGATOR_ENABLED.description: Enable sending logs to external log aggregator.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_PROTOCOL.title: Logging Aggregator Protocol
LOG_AGGREGATOR_PROTOCOL.description:
Protocol used to communicate with log aggregator.  HTTPS/HTTP assumes HTTPS unless http:// is explicitly used in the Logging Aggregator hostname.

* `https` - HTTPS/HTTP
* `tcp` - TCP
* `udp` - UDP

LOG_AGGREGATOR_TCP_TIMEOUT.title: TCP Connection Timeout
LOG_AGGREGATOR_TCP_TIMEOUT.description: Number of seconds for a TCP connection to external log aggregator to timeout. Applies to HTTPS and TCP log aggregator protocols.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_VERIFY_CERT.title: Enable/disable HTTPS certificate verification
LOG_AGGREGATOR_VERIFY_CERT.description: Flag to control enable/disable of certificate verification when LOG_AGGREGATOR_PROTOCOL is "https". If enabled, the log handler will verify certificate sent by external log aggregator before establishing connection.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_LEVEL.title: Logging Aggregator Level Threshold
LOG_AGGREGATOR_LEVEL.description:
Level threshold used by log handler. Severities from lowest to highest are DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL. Messages less severe than the threshold will be ignored by log handler. (messages under category awx.anlytics ignore this setting)

* `DEBUG` - DEBUG
* `INFO` - INFO
* `WARNING` - WARNING
* `ERROR` - ERROR
* `CRITICAL` - CRITICAL

LOG_AGGREGATOR_ACTION_QUEUE_SIZE.title: Maximum number of messages that can be stored in the log action queue
LOG_AGGREGATOR_ACTION_QUEUE_SIZE.description: Defines how large the rsyslog action queue can grow in number of messages stored. This can have an impact on memory utilization. When the queue reaches 75% of this number, the queue will start writing to disk (queue.highWatermark in rsyslog). When it reaches 90%, NOTICE, INFO, and DEBUG messages will start to be discarded (queue.discardMark with queue.discardSeverity=5).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_ACTION_MAX_DISK_USAGE_GB.title: Maximum disk persistence for rsyslogd action queuing (in GB)
LOG_AGGREGATOR_ACTION_MAX_DISK_USAGE_GB.description: Amount of data to store (in gigabytes) if an rsyslog action takes time to process an incoming message (defaults to 1). Equivalent to the rsyslogd queue.maxdiskspace setting on the action (e.g. omhttp). It stores files in the directory specified by LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_PATH.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_PATH.title: File system location for rsyslogd disk persistence
LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_PATH.description: Location to persist logs that should be retried after an outage of the external log aggregator (defaults to /var/lib/awx). Equivalent to the rsyslogd queue.spoolDirectory setting.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_RSYSLOGD_DEBUG.title: Enable rsyslogd debugging
LOG_AGGREGATOR_RSYSLOGD_DEBUG.description: Enabled high verbosity debugging for rsyslogd.  Useful for debugging connection issues for external log aggregation.

API_400_ERROR_LOG_FORMAT.default: status {status_code} received by user {user_name} attempting to access {url_path} from {remote_addr}
API_400_ERROR_LOG_FORMAT.title: Log Format For API 4XX Errors
API_400_ERROR_LOG_FORMAT.description:
The format of logged messages when an API 4XX error occurs, the following variables will be substituted: 
status_code - The HTTP status code of the error
user_name - The user name attempting to use the API
url_path - The URL path to the API endpoint called
remote_addr - The remote address seen for the user
error - The error set by the api endpoint
Variables need to be in the format {<variable name>}.

AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_LAST_GATHER.title: Last gather date for Automation Analytics.

AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_LAST_ENTRIES.title: Last gathered entries from the data collection service of Automation Analytics

BULK_JOB_MAX_LAUNCH.title: Max jobs to allow bulk jobs to launch
BULK_JOB_MAX_LAUNCH.description: Max jobs to allow bulk jobs to launch

BULK_HOST_MAX_CREATE.title: Max number of hosts to allow to be created in a single bulk action
BULK_HOST_MAX_CREATE.description: Max number of hosts to allow to be created in a single bulk action

BULK_HOST_MAX_DELETE.title: Max number of hosts to allow to be deleted in a single bulk action
BULK_HOST_MAX_DELETE.description: Max number of hosts to allow to be deleted in a single bulk action

SUBSCRIPTION_USAGE_MODEL.title: Defines subscription usage model and shows Host Metrics

AWX_CLEANUP_PATHS.title: Enable or Disable tmp dir cleanup
AWX_CLEANUP_PATHS.description: Enable or Disable TMP Dir cleanup

DEFAULT_CONTAINER_RUN_OPTIONS.title: Container Run Options
DEFAULT_CONTAINER_RUN_OPTIONS.description: List of options to pass to podman run example: ['--network', 'slirp4netns:enable_ipv6=true', '--log-level', 'debug']

RECEPTOR_KEEP_WORK_ON_ERROR.title: Keep receptor work on error
RECEPTOR_KEEP_WORK_ON_ERROR.description: Prevent receptor work from being released on when error is detected

OPA_HOST.title: OPA server hostname
OPA_HOST.description: The hostname used to connect to the OPA server. If empty, policy enforcement will be disabled.

OPA_PORT.title: OPA server port
OPA_PORT.description: The port used to connect to the OPA server. Defaults to 8181.

OPA_SSL.title: Use SSL for OPA connection
OPA_SSL.description: Enable or disable the use of SSL to connect to the OPA server. Defaults to false.

OPA_AUTH_TYPE.title: OPA authentication type
OPA_AUTH_TYPE.description:
The authentication type that will be used to connect to the OPA server: "None", "Token", or "Certificate".

* `None` - None
* `Token` - Token
* `Certificate` - Certificate

OPA_AUTH_TOKEN.title: OPA authentication token
OPA_AUTH_TOKEN.description: The token for authentication to the OPA server. Required when OPA_AUTH_TYPE is "Token". If an authorization header is defined in OPA_AUTH_CUSTOM_HEADERS, it will be overridden by OPA_AUTH_TOKEN.

OPA_AUTH_CLIENT_CERT.title: OPA client certificate content
OPA_AUTH_CLIENT_CERT.description: The content of the client certificate file for mTLS authentication to the OPA server. Required when OPA_AUTH_TYPE is "Certificate".

OPA_AUTH_CLIENT_KEY.title: OPA client key content
OPA_AUTH_CLIENT_KEY.description: The content of the client key for mTLS authentication to the OPA server. Required when OPA_AUTH_TYPE is "Certificate".

OPA_AUTH_CA_CERT.title: OPA CA certificate content
OPA_AUTH_CA_CERT.description: The content of the CA certificate for mTLS authentication to the OPA server. Required when OPA_AUTH_TYPE is "Certificate".

OPA_AUTH_CUSTOM_HEADERS.title: OPA custom authentication headers
OPA_AUTH_CUSTOM_HEADERS.description: Optional custom headers included in requests to the OPA server. Defaults to empty dictionary ({}).

OPA_REQUEST_TIMEOUT.description: The number of seconds after which the connection to the OPA server will time out. Defaults to 1.5 seconds.

OPA_REQUEST_RETRIES.title: OPA request retry count
OPA_REQUEST_RETRIES.description: The number of retry attempts for connecting to the OPA server. Default is 2.

SESSION_COOKIE_AGE.title: Idle Time Force Log Out
SESSION_COOKIE_AGE.description: Number of seconds that a user is inactive before they will need to login again.

SESSIONS_PER_USER.title: Maximum number of simultaneous logged in sessions
SESSIONS_PER_USER.description: Maximum number of simultaneous logged in sessions a user may have. To disable enter -1.

DISABLE_LOCAL_AUTH.title: Disable the built-in authentication system
DISABLE_LOCAL_AUTH.description: Controls whether users are prevented from using the built-in authentication system.

AUTH_BASIC_ENABLED.title: Enable HTTP Basic Auth
AUTH_BASIC_ENABLED.description: Enable HTTP Basic Auth for the API Browser.

LOGIN_REDIRECT_OVERRIDE.title: Login redirect override URL
LOGIN_REDIRECT_OVERRIDE.description: URL to which unauthorized users will be redirected to log in.  If blank, users will be sent to the login page.

ALLOW_METRICS_FOR_ANONYMOUS_USERS.title: Allow anonymous users to poll metrics
ALLOW_METRICS_FOR_ANONYMOUS_USERS.description: If true, anonymous users are allowed to poll metrics.

CUSTOM_LOGIN_INFO.description: If needed, you can add specific information (such as a legal notice or a disclaimer) to a text box in the login modal using this setting. Any content added must be in plain text or an HTML fragment, as other markup languages are not supported.

CUSTOM_LOGO.description: To set up a custom logo, provide a file that you create. For the custom logo to look its best, use a .png file with a transparent background. GIF, PNG and JPEG formats are supported.

MAX_UI_JOB_EVENTS.title: Max Job Events Retrieved by UI
MAX_UI_JOB_EVENTS.description: Maximum number of job events for the UI to retrieve within a single request.

UI_LIVE_UPDATES_ENABLED.title: Enable Live Updates in the UI
UI_LIVE_UPDATES_ENABLED.description: If disabled, the page will not refresh when events are received. Reloading the page will be required to get the latest details.

username.description: Required. 150 characters or fewer. Letters, digits and @/./+/-/_ only.

is_superuser.description: Designates that this user has all permissions without explicitly assigning them.

password.description: Field used to change the password.

SettingSingleton.description: Present a group of settings (by category) as a single object.

ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED.title: Enable Activity Stream
ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED.description: Enable capturing activity for the activity stream.

ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED_FOR_INVENTORY_SY.title: Enable Activity Stream for Inventory Sync
ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED_FOR_INVENTORY_SY.description: Enable capturing activity for the activity stream when running inventory sync.

ORG_ADMINS_CAN_SEE_ALL_USERS.title: All Users Visible to Organization Admins
ORG_ADMINS_CAN_SEE_ALL_USERS.description: Controls whether any Organization Admin can view all users and teams, even those not associated with their Organization.

MANAGE_ORGANIZATION_AUTH.title: Organization Admins Can Manage Users and Teams
MANAGE_ORGANIZATION_AUTH.description: Controls whether any Organization Admin has the privileges to create and manage users and teams.

TOWER_URL_BASE.title: Base URL of the service
TOWER_URL_BASE.description: This setting is used by services like notifications to render a valid url to the service.

REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS.description: HTTP headers and meta keys to search to determine remote host name or IP. Add additional items to this list, such as "HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR", if behind a reverse proxy. See the "Proxy Support" section of the AAP Installation guide for more details.

PROXY_IP_ALLOWED_LIST.description: If the service is behind a reverse proxy/load balancer, use this setting to configure the proxy IP addresses from which the service should trust custom REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS header values. If this setting is an empty list (the default), the headers specified by REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS will be trusted unconditionally')

CSRF_TRUSTED_ORIGINS.title: CSRF Trusted Origins List
CSRF_TRUSTED_ORIGINS.description: If the service is behind a reverse proxy/load balancer, use this setting to configure the schema://addresses from which the service should trust Origin header values.

LICENSE.description: The license controls which features and functionality are enabled. Use /api/v2/config/ to update or change the license.

REDHAT_USERNAME.title: Red Hat Client ID for Analytics
REDHAT_USERNAME.description: Client ID used to send data to Automation Analytics

REDHAT_PASSWORD.title: Red Hat Client Secret for Analytics
REDHAT_PASSWORD.description: Client secret used to send data to Automation Analytics

SUBSCRIPTIONS_USERNAME.title: Red Hat Username for Subscriptions
SUBSCRIPTIONS_USERNAME.description: Username used to retrieve subscription and content information

SUBSCRIPTIONS_PASSWORD.title: Red Hat Password for Subscriptions
SUBSCRIPTIONS_PASSWORD.description: Password used to retrieve subscription and content information

SUBSCRIPTIONS_CLIENT_ID.title: Red Hat Client ID for Subscriptions
SUBSCRIPTIONS_CLIENT_ID.description: Client ID used to retrieve subscription and content information

SUBSCRIPTIONS_CLIENT_SECRET.title: Red Hat Client Secret for Subscriptions
SUBSCRIPTIONS_CLIENT_SECRET.description: Client secret used to retrieve subscription and content information

AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_URL.title: Automation Analytics upload URL
AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_URL.description: This setting is used to to configure the upload URL for data collection for Automation Analytics.

DEFAULT_CONTROL_PLANE_QUEUE_NAME.title: The instance group where control plane tasks run

DEFAULT_EXECUTION_QUEUE_NAME.title: The instance group where user jobs run (currently only on non-VM installs)

DEFAULT_EXECUTION_ENVIRONMENT.title: Global default execution environment
DEFAULT_EXECUTION_ENVIRONMENT.description: The Execution Environment to be used when one has not been configured for a job template.

CUSTOM_VENV_PATHS.title: Custom virtual environment paths
CUSTOM_VENV_PATHS.description: Paths where Tower will look for custom virtual environments (in addition to /var/lib/awx/venv/). Enter one path per line.

AD_HOC_COMMANDS.title: Ansible Modules Allowed for Ad Hoc Jobs
AD_HOC_COMMANDS.description: List of modules allowed to be used by ad-hoc jobs.

ALLOW_JINJA_IN_EXTRA_VARS.title: When can extra variables contain Jinja templates?
ALLOW_JINJA_IN_EXTRA_VARS.description:
Ansible allows variable substitution via the Jinja2 templating language for --extra-vars. This poses a potential security risk where users with the ability to specify extra vars at job launch time can use Jinja2 templates to run arbitrary Python.  It is recommended that this value be set to "template" or "never".

* `always` - Always
* `never` - Never
* `template` - Only On Job Template Definitions

AWX_ISOLATION_BASE_PATH.title: Job execution path
AWX_ISOLATION_BASE_PATH.description: The directory in which the service will create new temporary directories for job execution and isolation (such as credential files).

AWX_ISOLATION_SHOW_PATHS.title: Paths to expose to isolated jobs
AWX_ISOLATION_SHOW_PATHS.description: List of paths that would otherwise be hidden to expose to isolated jobs. Enter one path per line. Volumes will be mounted from the execution node to the container. The supported format is HOST-DIR[:CONTAINER-DIR[:OPTIONS]].

AWX_TASK_ENV.title: Extra Environment Variables
AWX_TASK_ENV.description: Additional environment variables set for playbook runs, inventory updates, project updates, and notification sending.

AWX_RUNNER_KEEPALIVE_SECONDS.title: K8S Ansible Runner Keep-Alive Message Interval
AWX_RUNNER_KEEPALIVE_SECONDS.description: Only applies to jobs running in a Container Group. If not 0, send a message every so-many seconds to keep connection open.

GALAXY_TASK_ENV.title: Environment Variables for Galaxy Commands
GALAXY_TASK_ENV.description: Additional environment variables set for invocations of ansible-galaxy within project updates. Useful if you must use a proxy server for ansible-galaxy but not git.

INSIGHTS_TRACKING_STATE.title: Gather data for Automation Analytics
INSIGHTS_TRACKING_STATE.description: Enables the service to gather data on automation and send it to Automation Analytics.

PROJECT_UPDATE_VVV.title: Run Project Updates With Higher Verbosity
PROJECT_UPDATE_VVV.description: Adds the CLI -vvv flag to ansible-playbook runs of project_update.yml used for project updates.

AWX_ROLES_ENABLED.title: Enable Role Download
AWX_ROLES_ENABLED.description: Allows roles to be dynamically downloaded from a requirements.yml file for SCM projects.

AWX_COLLECTIONS_ENABLED.title: Enable Collection(s) Download
AWX_COLLECTIONS_ENABLED.description: Allows collections to be dynamically downloaded from a requirements.yml file for SCM projects.

AWX_SHOW_PLAYBOOK_LINKS.title: Follow symlinks
AWX_SHOW_PLAYBOOK_LINKS.description: Follow symbolic links when scanning for playbooks. Be aware that setting this to True can lead to infinite recursion if a link points to a parent directory of itself.

AWX_MOUNT_ISOLATED_PATHS_ON_K8S.title: Expose host paths for Container Groups
AWX_MOUNT_ISOLATED_PATHS_ON_K8S.description: Expose paths via hostPath for the Pods created by a Container Group. HostPath volumes present many security risks, and it is a best practice to avoid the use of HostPaths when possible.

GALAXY_IGNORE_CERTS.title: Ignore Ansible Galaxy SSL Certificate Verification
GALAXY_IGNORE_CERTS.description: If set to true, certificate validation will not be done when installing content from any Galaxy server.

STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.title: Standard Output Maximum Display Size
STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.description: Maximum Size of Standard Output in bytes to display before requiring the output be downloaded.

EVENT_STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.title: Job Event Standard Output Maximum Display Size
EVENT_STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.description: Maximum Size of Standard Output in bytes to display for a single job or ad hoc command event. `stdout` will end with `` when truncated.

MAX_WEBSOCKET_EVENT_RATE.title: Job Event Maximum Websocket Messages Per Second
MAX_WEBSOCKET_EVENT_RATE.description: Maximum number of messages to update the UI live job output with per second. Value of 0 means no limit.

SCHEDULE_MAX_JOBS.title: Maximum Scheduled Jobs
SCHEDULE_MAX_JOBS.description: Maximum number of the same job template that can be waiting to run when launching from a schedule before no more are created.

AWX_ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS.title: Ansible Callback Plugins
AWX_ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS.description: List of paths to search for extra callback plugins to be used when running jobs. Enter one path per line.

DEFAULT_JOB_TIMEOUT.description: Maximum time in seconds to allow jobs to run. Use value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed. A timeout set on an individual job template will override this.

DEFAULT_JOB_IDLE_TIMEOUT.description: If no output is detected from ansible in this number of seconds the execution will be terminated. Use value of 0 to indicate that no idle timeout should be imposed.

DEFAULT_INVENTORY_UPDATE_TIMEOUT.description: Maximum time in seconds to allow inventory updates to run. Use value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed. A timeout set on an individual inventory source will override this.

DEFAULT_PROJECT_UPDATE_TIMEOUT.description: Maximum time in seconds to allow project updates to run. Use value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed. A timeout set on an individual project will override this.

ANSIBLE_FACT_CACHE_TIMEOUT.title: Per-Host Ansible Fact Cache Timeout
ANSIBLE_FACT_CACHE_TIMEOUT.description: Maximum time, in seconds, that stored Ansible facts are considered valid since the last time they were modified. Only valid, non-stale, facts will be accessible by a playbook. Note, this does not influence the deletion of ansible_facts from the database. Use a value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed.

MAX_FORKS.title: Maximum number of forks per job
MAX_FORKS.description: Saving a Job Template with more than this number of forks will result in an error. When set to 0, no limit is applied.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_HOST.title: Logging Aggregator
LOG_AGGREGATOR_HOST.description: Hostname/IP where external logs will be sent to.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_PORT.title: Logging Aggregator Port
LOG_AGGREGATOR_PORT.description: Port on Logging Aggregator to send logs to (if required and not provided in Logging Aggregator).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_TYPE.title: Logging Aggregator Type
LOG_AGGREGATOR_TYPE.description:
Format messages for the chosen log aggregator.

* `logstash` - logstash
* `splunk` - splunk
* `loggly` - loggly
* `sumologic` - sumologic
* `other` - other

LOG_AGGREGATOR_USERNAME.title: Logging Aggregator Username
LOG_AGGREGATOR_USERNAME.description: Username for external log aggregator (if required; HTTP/s only).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_PASSWORD.title: Logging Aggregator Password/Token
LOG_AGGREGATOR_PASSWORD.description: Password or authentication token for external log aggregator (if required; HTTP/s only).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_LOGGERS.title: Loggers Sending Data to Log Aggregator Form
LOG_AGGREGATOR_LOGGERS.description:
List of loggers that will send HTTP logs to the collector, these can include any or all of: 
awx - service logs
activity_stream - activity stream records
job_events - callback data from Ansible job events
system_tracking - facts gathered from scan jobs
broadcast_websocket - errors pertaining to websockets broadcast metrics
job_lifecycle - logs related to processing of a job

LOG_AGGREGATOR_INDIVIDUAL_FACTS.title: Log System Tracking Facts Individually
LOG_AGGREGATOR_INDIVIDUAL_FACTS.description: If set, system tracking facts will be sent for each package, service, or other item found in a scan, allowing for greater search query granularity. If unset, facts will be sent as a single dictionary, allowing for greater efficiency in fact processing.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_ENABLED.title: Enable External Logging
LOG_AGGREGATOR_ENABLED.description: Enable sending logs to external log aggregator.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_PROTOCOL.title: Logging Aggregator Protocol
LOG_AGGREGATOR_PROTOCOL.description:
Protocol used to communicate with log aggregator.  HTTPS/HTTP assumes HTTPS unless http:// is explicitly used in the Logging Aggregator hostname.

* `https` - HTTPS/HTTP
* `tcp` - TCP
* `udp` - UDP

LOG_AGGREGATOR_TCP_TIMEOUT.title: TCP Connection Timeout
LOG_AGGREGATOR_TCP_TIMEOUT.description: Number of seconds for a TCP connection to external log aggregator to timeout. Applies to HTTPS and TCP log aggregator protocols.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_VERIFY_CERT.title: Enable/disable HTTPS certificate verification
LOG_AGGREGATOR_VERIFY_CERT.description: Flag to control enable/disable of certificate verification when LOG_AGGREGATOR_PROTOCOL is "https". If enabled, the log handler will verify certificate sent by external log aggregator before establishing connection.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_LEVEL.title: Logging Aggregator Level Threshold
LOG_AGGREGATOR_LEVEL.description:
Level threshold used by log handler. Severities from lowest to highest are DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL. Messages less severe than the threshold will be ignored by log handler. (messages under category awx.anlytics ignore this setting)

* `DEBUG` - DEBUG
* `INFO` - INFO
* `WARNING` - WARNING
* `ERROR` - ERROR
* `CRITICAL` - CRITICAL

LOG_AGGREGATOR_ACTION_QUEUE_SIZE.title: Maximum number of messages that can be stored in the log action queue
LOG_AGGREGATOR_ACTION_QUEUE_SIZE.description: Defines how large the rsyslog action queue can grow in number of messages stored. This can have an impact on memory utilization. When the queue reaches 75% of this number, the queue will start writing to disk (queue.highWatermark in rsyslog). When it reaches 90%, NOTICE, INFO, and DEBUG messages will start to be discarded (queue.discardMark with queue.discardSeverity=5).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_ACTION_MAX_DISK_USAGE_GB.title: Maximum disk persistence for rsyslogd action queuing (in GB)
LOG_AGGREGATOR_ACTION_MAX_DISK_USAGE_GB.description: Amount of data to store (in gigabytes) if an rsyslog action takes time to process an incoming message (defaults to 1). Equivalent to the rsyslogd queue.maxdiskspace setting on the action (e.g. omhttp). It stores files in the directory specified by LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_PATH.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_PATH.title: File system location for rsyslogd disk persistence
LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_PATH.description: Location to persist logs that should be retried after an outage of the external log aggregator (defaults to /var/lib/awx). Equivalent to the rsyslogd queue.spoolDirectory setting.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_RSYSLOGD_DEBUG.title: Enable rsyslogd debugging
LOG_AGGREGATOR_RSYSLOGD_DEBUG.description: Enabled high verbosity debugging for rsyslogd.  Useful for debugging connection issues for external log aggregation.

API_400_ERROR_LOG_FORMAT.default: status {status_code} received by user {user_name} attempting to access {url_path} from {remote_addr}
API_400_ERROR_LOG_FORMAT.title: Log Format For API 4XX Errors
API_400_ERROR_LOG_FORMAT.description:
The format of logged messages when an API 4XX error occurs, the following variables will be substituted: 
status_code - The HTTP status code of the error
user_name - The user name attempting to use the API
url_path - The URL path to the API endpoint called
remote_addr - The remote address seen for the user
error - The error set by the api endpoint
Variables need to be in the format {<variable name>}.

AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_LAST_GATHER.title: Last gather date for Automation Analytics.

AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_LAST_ENTRIES.title: Last gathered entries from the data collection service of Automation Analytics

IS_K8S.description: Indicates whether the instance is part of a kubernetes-based deployment.

BULK_JOB_MAX_LAUNCH.title: Max jobs to allow bulk jobs to launch
BULK_JOB_MAX_LAUNCH.description: Max jobs to allow bulk jobs to launch

BULK_HOST_MAX_CREATE.title: Max number of hosts to allow to be created in a single bulk action
BULK_HOST_MAX_CREATE.description: Max number of hosts to allow to be created in a single bulk action

BULK_HOST_MAX_DELETE.title: Max number of hosts to allow to be deleted in a single bulk action
BULK_HOST_MAX_DELETE.description: Max number of hosts to allow to be deleted in a single bulk action

SUBSCRIPTION_USAGE_MODEL.title: Defines subscription usage model and shows Host Metrics

AWX_CLEANUP_PATHS.title: Enable or Disable tmp dir cleanup
AWX_CLEANUP_PATHS.description: Enable or Disable TMP Dir cleanup

DEFAULT_CONTAINER_RUN_OPTIONS.title: Container Run Options
DEFAULT_CONTAINER_RUN_OPTIONS.description: List of options to pass to podman run example: ['--network', 'slirp4netns:enable_ipv6=true', '--log-level', 'debug']

RECEPTOR_KEEP_WORK_ON_ERROR.title: Keep receptor work on error
RECEPTOR_KEEP_WORK_ON_ERROR.description: Prevent receptor work from being released on when error is detected

OPA_HOST.title: OPA server hostname
OPA_HOST.description: The hostname used to connect to the OPA server. If empty, policy enforcement will be disabled.

OPA_PORT.title: OPA server port
OPA_PORT.description: The port used to connect to the OPA server. Defaults to 8181.

OPA_SSL.title: Use SSL for OPA connection
OPA_SSL.description: Enable or disable the use of SSL to connect to the OPA server. Defaults to false.

OPA_AUTH_TYPE.title: OPA authentication type
OPA_AUTH_TYPE.description:
The authentication type that will be used to connect to the OPA server: "None", "Token", or "Certificate".

* `None` - None
* `Token` - Token
* `Certificate` - Certificate

OPA_AUTH_TOKEN.title: OPA authentication token
OPA_AUTH_TOKEN.description: The token for authentication to the OPA server. Required when OPA_AUTH_TYPE is "Token". If an authorization header is defined in OPA_AUTH_CUSTOM_HEADERS, it will be overridden by OPA_AUTH_TOKEN.

OPA_AUTH_CLIENT_CERT.title: OPA client certificate content
OPA_AUTH_CLIENT_CERT.description: The content of the client certificate file for mTLS authentication to the OPA server. Required when OPA_AUTH_TYPE is "Certificate".

OPA_AUTH_CLIENT_KEY.title: OPA client key content
OPA_AUTH_CLIENT_KEY.description: The content of the client key for mTLS authentication to the OPA server. Required when OPA_AUTH_TYPE is "Certificate".

OPA_AUTH_CA_CERT.title: OPA CA certificate content
OPA_AUTH_CA_CERT.description: The content of the CA certificate for mTLS authentication to the OPA server. Required when OPA_AUTH_TYPE is "Certificate".

OPA_AUTH_CUSTOM_HEADERS.title: OPA custom authentication headers
OPA_AUTH_CUSTOM_HEADERS.description: Optional custom headers included in requests to the OPA server. Defaults to empty dictionary ({}).

OPA_REQUEST_TIMEOUT.description: The number of seconds after which the connection to the OPA server will time out. Defaults to 1.5 seconds.

OPA_REQUEST_RETRIES.title: OPA request retry count
OPA_REQUEST_RETRIES.description: The number of retry attempts for connecting to the OPA server. Default is 2.

SESSION_COOKIE_AGE.title: Idle Time Force Log Out
SESSION_COOKIE_AGE.description: Number of seconds that a user is inactive before they will need to login again.

SESSIONS_PER_USER.title: Maximum number of simultaneous logged in sessions
SESSIONS_PER_USER.description: Maximum number of simultaneous logged in sessions a user may have. To disable enter -1.

DISABLE_LOCAL_AUTH.title: Disable the built-in authentication system
DISABLE_LOCAL_AUTH.description: Controls whether users are prevented from using the built-in authentication system.

AUTH_BASIC_ENABLED.title: Enable HTTP Basic Auth
AUTH_BASIC_ENABLED.description: Enable HTTP Basic Auth for the API Browser.

LOGIN_REDIRECT_OVERRIDE.title: Login redirect override URL
LOGIN_REDIRECT_OVERRIDE.description: URL to which unauthorized users will be redirected to log in.  If blank, users will be sent to the login page.

ALLOW_METRICS_FOR_ANONYMOUS_USERS.title: Allow anonymous users to poll metrics
ALLOW_METRICS_FOR_ANONYMOUS_USERS.description: If true, anonymous users are allowed to poll metrics.

PENDO_TRACKING_STATE.title: User Analytics Tracking State
PENDO_TRACKING_STATE.description:
Enable or Disable User Analytics Tracking.

* `off` - Off
* `anonymous` - Anonymous
* `detailed` - Detailed

CUSTOM_LOGIN_INFO.description: If needed, you can add specific information (such as a legal notice or a disclaimer) to a text box in the login modal using this setting. Any content added must be in plain text or an HTML fragment, as other markup languages are not supported.

CUSTOM_LOGO.description: To set up a custom logo, provide a file that you create. For the custom logo to look its best, use a .png file with a transparent background. GIF, PNG and JPEG formats are supported.

MAX_UI_JOB_EVENTS.title: Max Job Events Retrieved by UI
MAX_UI_JOB_EVENTS.description: Maximum number of job events for the UI to retrieve within a single request.

UI_LIVE_UPDATES_ENABLED.title: Enable Live Updates in the UI
UI_LIVE_UPDATES_ENABLED.description: If disabled, the page will not refresh when events are received. Reloading the page will be required to get the latest details.

NAMED_URL_FORMATS.title: Formats of all available named urls
NAMED_URL_FORMATS.description: Read-only list of key-value pairs that shows the standard format of all available named URLs.

NAMED_URL_GRAPH_NODES.title: List of all named url graph nodes.
NAMED_URL_GRAPH_NODES.description: Read-only list of key-value pairs that exposes named URL graph topology. Use this list to programmatically generate named URLs for resources

SettingSingletonRequest.description: Present a group of settings (by category) as a single object.

ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED.title: Enable Activity Stream
ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED.description: Enable capturing activity for the activity stream.

ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED_FOR_INVENTORY_SY.title: Enable Activity Stream for Inventory Sync
ACTIVITY_STREAM_ENABLED_FOR_INVENTORY_SY.description: Enable capturing activity for the activity stream when running inventory sync.

ORG_ADMINS_CAN_SEE_ALL_USERS.title: All Users Visible to Organization Admins
ORG_ADMINS_CAN_SEE_ALL_USERS.description: Controls whether any Organization Admin can view all users and teams, even those not associated with their Organization.

MANAGE_ORGANIZATION_AUTH.title: Organization Admins Can Manage Users and Teams
MANAGE_ORGANIZATION_AUTH.description: Controls whether any Organization Admin has the privileges to create and manage users and teams.

TOWER_URL_BASE.title: Base URL of the service
TOWER_URL_BASE.description: This setting is used by services like notifications to render a valid url to the service.

REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS.description: HTTP headers and meta keys to search to determine remote host name or IP. Add additional items to this list, such as "HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR", if behind a reverse proxy. See the "Proxy Support" section of the AAP Installation guide for more details.

PROXY_IP_ALLOWED_LIST.description: If the service is behind a reverse proxy/load balancer, use this setting to configure the proxy IP addresses from which the service should trust custom REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS header values. If this setting is an empty list (the default), the headers specified by REMOTE_HOST_HEADERS will be trusted unconditionally')

CSRF_TRUSTED_ORIGINS.title: CSRF Trusted Origins List
CSRF_TRUSTED_ORIGINS.description: If the service is behind a reverse proxy/load balancer, use this setting to configure the schema://addresses from which the service should trust Origin header values.

REDHAT_USERNAME.title: Red Hat Client ID for Analytics
REDHAT_USERNAME.description: Client ID used to send data to Automation Analytics

REDHAT_PASSWORD.title: Red Hat Client Secret for Analytics
REDHAT_PASSWORD.description: Client secret used to send data to Automation Analytics

SUBSCRIPTIONS_USERNAME.title: Red Hat Username for Subscriptions
SUBSCRIPTIONS_USERNAME.description: Username used to retrieve subscription and content information

SUBSCRIPTIONS_PASSWORD.title: Red Hat Password for Subscriptions
SUBSCRIPTIONS_PASSWORD.description: Password used to retrieve subscription and content information

SUBSCRIPTIONS_CLIENT_ID.title: Red Hat Client ID for Subscriptions
SUBSCRIPTIONS_CLIENT_ID.description: Client ID used to retrieve subscription and content information

SUBSCRIPTIONS_CLIENT_SECRET.title: Red Hat Client Secret for Subscriptions
SUBSCRIPTIONS_CLIENT_SECRET.description: Client secret used to retrieve subscription and content information

AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_URL.title: Automation Analytics upload URL
AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_URL.description: This setting is used to to configure the upload URL for data collection for Automation Analytics.

DEFAULT_EXECUTION_ENVIRONMENT.title: Global default execution environment
DEFAULT_EXECUTION_ENVIRONMENT.description: The Execution Environment to be used when one has not been configured for a job template.

CUSTOM_VENV_PATHS.title: Custom virtual environment paths
CUSTOM_VENV_PATHS.description: Paths where Tower will look for custom virtual environments (in addition to /var/lib/awx/venv/). Enter one path per line.

AD_HOC_COMMANDS.title: Ansible Modules Allowed for Ad Hoc Jobs
AD_HOC_COMMANDS.description: List of modules allowed to be used by ad-hoc jobs.

ALLOW_JINJA_IN_EXTRA_VARS.title: When can extra variables contain Jinja templates?
ALLOW_JINJA_IN_EXTRA_VARS.description:
Ansible allows variable substitution via the Jinja2 templating language for --extra-vars. This poses a potential security risk where users with the ability to specify extra vars at job launch time can use Jinja2 templates to run arbitrary Python.  It is recommended that this value be set to "template" or "never".

* `always` - Always
* `never` - Never
* `template` - Only On Job Template Definitions

AWX_ISOLATION_BASE_PATH.title: Job execution path
AWX_ISOLATION_BASE_PATH.description: The directory in which the service will create new temporary directories for job execution and isolation (such as credential files).

AWX_ISOLATION_SHOW_PATHS.title: Paths to expose to isolated jobs
AWX_ISOLATION_SHOW_PATHS.description: List of paths that would otherwise be hidden to expose to isolated jobs. Enter one path per line. Volumes will be mounted from the execution node to the container. The supported format is HOST-DIR[:CONTAINER-DIR[:OPTIONS]].

AWX_TASK_ENV.title: Extra Environment Variables
AWX_TASK_ENV.description: Additional environment variables set for playbook runs, inventory updates, project updates, and notification sending.

AWX_RUNNER_KEEPALIVE_SECONDS.title: K8S Ansible Runner Keep-Alive Message Interval
AWX_RUNNER_KEEPALIVE_SECONDS.description: Only applies to jobs running in a Container Group. If not 0, send a message every so-many seconds to keep connection open.

GALAXY_TASK_ENV.title: Environment Variables for Galaxy Commands
GALAXY_TASK_ENV.description: Additional environment variables set for invocations of ansible-galaxy within project updates. Useful if you must use a proxy server for ansible-galaxy but not git.

INSIGHTS_TRACKING_STATE.title: Gather data for Automation Analytics
INSIGHTS_TRACKING_STATE.description: Enables the service to gather data on automation and send it to Automation Analytics.

PROJECT_UPDATE_VVV.title: Run Project Updates With Higher Verbosity
PROJECT_UPDATE_VVV.description: Adds the CLI -vvv flag to ansible-playbook runs of project_update.yml used for project updates.

AWX_ROLES_ENABLED.title: Enable Role Download
AWX_ROLES_ENABLED.description: Allows roles to be dynamically downloaded from a requirements.yml file for SCM projects.

AWX_COLLECTIONS_ENABLED.title: Enable Collection(s) Download
AWX_COLLECTIONS_ENABLED.description: Allows collections to be dynamically downloaded from a requirements.yml file for SCM projects.

AWX_SHOW_PLAYBOOK_LINKS.title: Follow symlinks
AWX_SHOW_PLAYBOOK_LINKS.description: Follow symbolic links when scanning for playbooks. Be aware that setting this to True can lead to infinite recursion if a link points to a parent directory of itself.

AWX_MOUNT_ISOLATED_PATHS_ON_K8S.title: Expose host paths for Container Groups
AWX_MOUNT_ISOLATED_PATHS_ON_K8S.description: Expose paths via hostPath for the Pods created by a Container Group. HostPath volumes present many security risks, and it is a best practice to avoid the use of HostPaths when possible.

GALAXY_IGNORE_CERTS.title: Ignore Ansible Galaxy SSL Certificate Verification
GALAXY_IGNORE_CERTS.description: If set to true, certificate validation will not be done when installing content from any Galaxy server.

STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.title: Standard Output Maximum Display Size
STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.description: Maximum Size of Standard Output in bytes to display before requiring the output be downloaded.

EVENT_STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.title: Job Event Standard Output Maximum Display Size
EVENT_STDOUT_MAX_BYTES_DISPLAY.description: Maximum Size of Standard Output in bytes to display for a single job or ad hoc command event. `stdout` will end with `` when truncated.

MAX_WEBSOCKET_EVENT_RATE.title: Job Event Maximum Websocket Messages Per Second
MAX_WEBSOCKET_EVENT_RATE.description: Maximum number of messages to update the UI live job output with per second. Value of 0 means no limit.

SCHEDULE_MAX_JOBS.title: Maximum Scheduled Jobs
SCHEDULE_MAX_JOBS.description: Maximum number of the same job template that can be waiting to run when launching from a schedule before no more are created.

AWX_ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS.title: Ansible Callback Plugins
AWX_ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS.description: List of paths to search for extra callback plugins to be used when running jobs. Enter one path per line.

DEFAULT_JOB_TIMEOUT.description: Maximum time in seconds to allow jobs to run. Use value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed. A timeout set on an individual job template will override this.

DEFAULT_JOB_IDLE_TIMEOUT.description: If no output is detected from ansible in this number of seconds the execution will be terminated. Use value of 0 to indicate that no idle timeout should be imposed.

DEFAULT_INVENTORY_UPDATE_TIMEOUT.description: Maximum time in seconds to allow inventory updates to run. Use value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed. A timeout set on an individual inventory source will override this.

DEFAULT_PROJECT_UPDATE_TIMEOUT.description: Maximum time in seconds to allow project updates to run. Use value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed. A timeout set on an individual project will override this.

ANSIBLE_FACT_CACHE_TIMEOUT.title: Per-Host Ansible Fact Cache Timeout
ANSIBLE_FACT_CACHE_TIMEOUT.description: Maximum time, in seconds, that stored Ansible facts are considered valid since the last time they were modified. Only valid, non-stale, facts will be accessible by a playbook. Note, this does not influence the deletion of ansible_facts from the database. Use a value of 0 to indicate that no timeout should be imposed.

MAX_FORKS.title: Maximum number of forks per job
MAX_FORKS.description: Saving a Job Template with more than this number of forks will result in an error. When set to 0, no limit is applied.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_HOST.title: Logging Aggregator
LOG_AGGREGATOR_HOST.description: Hostname/IP where external logs will be sent to.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_PORT.title: Logging Aggregator Port
LOG_AGGREGATOR_PORT.description: Port on Logging Aggregator to send logs to (if required and not provided in Logging Aggregator).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_TYPE.title: Logging Aggregator Type
LOG_AGGREGATOR_TYPE.description:
Format messages for the chosen log aggregator.

* `logstash` - logstash
* `splunk` - splunk
* `loggly` - loggly
* `sumologic` - sumologic
* `other` - other

LOG_AGGREGATOR_USERNAME.title: Logging Aggregator Username
LOG_AGGREGATOR_USERNAME.description: Username for external log aggregator (if required; HTTP/s only).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_PASSWORD.title: Logging Aggregator Password/Token
LOG_AGGREGATOR_PASSWORD.description: Password or authentication token for external log aggregator (if required; HTTP/s only).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_LOGGERS.title: Loggers Sending Data to Log Aggregator Form
LOG_AGGREGATOR_LOGGERS.description:
List of loggers that will send HTTP logs to the collector, these can include any or all of: 
awx - service logs
activity_stream - activity stream records
job_events - callback data from Ansible job events
system_tracking - facts gathered from scan jobs
broadcast_websocket - errors pertaining to websockets broadcast metrics
job_lifecycle - logs related to processing of a job

LOG_AGGREGATOR_INDIVIDUAL_FACTS.title: Log System Tracking Facts Individually
LOG_AGGREGATOR_INDIVIDUAL_FACTS.description: If set, system tracking facts will be sent for each package, service, or other item found in a scan, allowing for greater search query granularity. If unset, facts will be sent as a single dictionary, allowing for greater efficiency in fact processing.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_ENABLED.title: Enable External Logging
LOG_AGGREGATOR_ENABLED.description: Enable sending logs to external log aggregator.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_PROTOCOL.title: Logging Aggregator Protocol
LOG_AGGREGATOR_PROTOCOL.description:
Protocol used to communicate with log aggregator.  HTTPS/HTTP assumes HTTPS unless http:// is explicitly used in the Logging Aggregator hostname.

* `https` - HTTPS/HTTP
* `tcp` - TCP
* `udp` - UDP

LOG_AGGREGATOR_TCP_TIMEOUT.title: TCP Connection Timeout
LOG_AGGREGATOR_TCP_TIMEOUT.description: Number of seconds for a TCP connection to external log aggregator to timeout. Applies to HTTPS and TCP log aggregator protocols.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_VERIFY_CERT.title: Enable/disable HTTPS certificate verification
LOG_AGGREGATOR_VERIFY_CERT.description: Flag to control enable/disable of certificate verification when LOG_AGGREGATOR_PROTOCOL is "https". If enabled, the log handler will verify certificate sent by external log aggregator before establishing connection.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_LEVEL.title: Logging Aggregator Level Threshold
LOG_AGGREGATOR_LEVEL.description:
Level threshold used by log handler. Severities from lowest to highest are DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL. Messages less severe than the threshold will be ignored by log handler. (messages under category awx.anlytics ignore this setting)

* `DEBUG` - DEBUG
* `INFO` - INFO
* `WARNING` - WARNING
* `ERROR` - ERROR
* `CRITICAL` - CRITICAL

LOG_AGGREGATOR_ACTION_QUEUE_SIZE.title: Maximum number of messages that can be stored in the log action queue
LOG_AGGREGATOR_ACTION_QUEUE_SIZE.description: Defines how large the rsyslog action queue can grow in number of messages stored. This can have an impact on memory utilization. When the queue reaches 75% of this number, the queue will start writing to disk (queue.highWatermark in rsyslog). When it reaches 90%, NOTICE, INFO, and DEBUG messages will start to be discarded (queue.discardMark with queue.discardSeverity=5).

LOG_AGGREGATOR_ACTION_MAX_DISK_USAGE_GB.title: Maximum disk persistence for rsyslogd action queuing (in GB)
LOG_AGGREGATOR_ACTION_MAX_DISK_USAGE_GB.description: Amount of data to store (in gigabytes) if an rsyslog action takes time to process an incoming message (defaults to 1). Equivalent to the rsyslogd queue.maxdiskspace setting on the action (e.g. omhttp). It stores files in the directory specified by LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_PATH.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_PATH.title: File system location for rsyslogd disk persistence
LOG_AGGREGATOR_MAX_DISK_USAGE_PATH.description: Location to persist logs that should be retried after an outage of the external log aggregator (defaults to /var/lib/awx). Equivalent to the rsyslogd queue.spoolDirectory setting.

LOG_AGGREGATOR_RSYSLOGD_DEBUG.title: Enable rsyslogd debugging
LOG_AGGREGATOR_RSYSLOGD_DEBUG.description: Enabled high verbosity debugging for rsyslogd.  Useful for debugging connection issues for external log aggregation.

API_400_ERROR_LOG_FORMAT.default: status {status_code} received by user {user_name} attempting to access {url_path} from {remote_addr}
API_400_ERROR_LOG_FORMAT.title: Log Format For API 4XX Errors
API_400_ERROR_LOG_FORMAT.description:
The format of logged messages when an API 4XX error occurs, the following variables will be substituted: 
status_code - The HTTP status code of the error
user_name - The user name attempting to use the API
url_path - The URL path to the API endpoint called
remote_addr - The remote address seen for the user
error - The error set by the api endpoint
Variables need to be in the format {<variable name>}.

AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_LAST_GATHER.title: Last gather date for Automation Analytics.

AUTOMATION_ANALYTICS_LAST_ENTRIES.title: Last gathered entries from the data collection service of Automation Analytics

BULK_JOB_MAX_LAUNCH.title: Max jobs to allow bulk jobs to launch
BULK_JOB_MAX_LAUNCH.description: Max jobs to allow bulk jobs to launch

BULK_HOST_MAX_CREATE.title: Max number of hosts to allow to be created in a single bulk action
BULK_HOST_MAX_CREATE.description: Max number of hosts to allow to be created in a single bulk action

BULK_HOST_MAX_DELETE.title: Max number of hosts to allow to be deleted in a single bulk action
BULK_HOST_MAX_DELETE.description: Max number of hosts to allow to be deleted in a single bulk action

SUBSCRIPTION_USAGE_MODEL.title: Defines subscription usage model and shows Host Metrics

AWX_CLEANUP_PATHS.title: Enable or Disable tmp dir cleanup
AWX_CLEANUP_PATHS.description: Enable or Disable TMP Dir cleanup

DEFAULT_CONTAINER_RUN_OPTIONS.title: Container Run Options
DEFAULT_CONTAINER_RUN_OPTIONS.description: List of options to pass to podman run example: ['--network', 'slirp4netns:enable_ipv6=true', '--log-level', 'debug']

RECEPTOR_KEEP_WORK_ON_ERROR.title: Keep receptor work on error
RECEPTOR_KEEP_WORK_ON_ERROR.description: Prevent receptor work from being released on when error is detected

OPA_HOST.title: OPA server hostname
OPA_HOST.description: The hostname used to connect to the OPA server. If empty, policy enforcement will be disabled.

OPA_PORT.title: OPA server port
OPA_PORT.description: The port used to connect to the OPA server. Defaults to 8181.

OPA_SSL.title: Use SSL for OPA connection
OPA_SSL.description: Enable or disable the use of SSL to connect to the OPA server. Defaults to false.

OPA_AUTH_TYPE.title: OPA authentication type
OPA_AUTH_TYPE.description:
The authentication type that will be used to connect to the OPA server: "None", "Token", or "Certificate".

* `None` - None
* `Token` - Token
* `Certificate` - Certificate

OPA_AUTH_TOKEN.title: OPA authentication token
OPA_AUTH_TOKEN.description: The token for authentication to the OPA server. Required when OPA_AUTH_TYPE is "Token". If an authorization header is defined in OPA_AUTH_CUSTOM_HEADERS, it will be overridden by OPA_AUTH_TOKEN.

OPA_AUTH_CLIENT_CERT.title: OPA client certificate content
OPA_AUTH_CLIENT_CERT.description: The content of the client certificate file for mTLS authentication to the OPA server. Required when OPA_AUTH_TYPE is "Certificate".

OPA_AUTH_CLIENT_KEY.title: OPA client key content
OPA_AUTH_CLIENT_KEY.description: The content of the client key for mTLS authentication to the OPA server. Required when OPA_AUTH_TYPE is "Certificate".

OPA_AUTH_CA_CERT.title: OPA CA certificate content
OPA_AUTH_CA_CERT.description: The content of the CA certificate for mTLS authentication to the OPA server. Required when OPA_AUTH_TYPE is "Certificate".

OPA_AUTH_CUSTOM_HEADERS.title: OPA custom authentication headers
OPA_AUTH_CUSTOM_HEADERS.description: Optional custom headers included in requests to the OPA server. Defaults to empty dictionary ({}).

OPA_REQUEST_TIMEOUT.description: The number of seconds after which the connection to the OPA server will time out. Defaults to 1.5 seconds.

OPA_REQUEST_RETRIES.title: OPA request retry count
OPA_REQUEST_RETRIES.description: The number of retry attempts for connecting to the OPA server. Default is 2.

SESSION_COOKIE_AGE.title: Idle Time Force Log Out
SESSION_COOKIE_AGE.description: Number of seconds that a user is inactive before they will need to login again.

SESSIONS_PER_USER.title: Maximum number of simultaneous logged in sessions
SESSIONS_PER_USER.description: Maximum number of simultaneous logged in sessions a user may have. To disable enter -1.

DISABLE_LOCAL_AUTH.title: Disable the built-in authentication system
DISABLE_LOCAL_AUTH.description: Controls whether users are prevented from using the built-in authentication system.

AUTH_BASIC_ENABLED.title: Enable HTTP Basic Auth
AUTH_BASIC_ENABLED.description: Enable HTTP Basic Auth for the API Browser.

LOGIN_REDIRECT_OVERRIDE.title: Login redirect override URL
LOGIN_REDIRECT_OVERRIDE.description: URL to which unauthorized users will be redirected to log in.  If blank, users will be sent to the login page.

ALLOW_METRICS_FOR_ANONYMOUS_USERS.title: Allow anonymous users to poll metrics
ALLOW_METRICS_FOR_ANONYMOUS_USERS.description: If true, anonymous users are allowed to poll metrics.

CUSTOM_LOGIN_INFO.description: If needed, you can add specific information (such as a legal notice or a disclaimer) to a text box in the login modal using this setting. Any content added must be in plain text or an HTML fragment, as other markup languages are not supported.

CUSTOM_LOGO.description: To set up a custom logo, provide a file that you create. For the custom logo to look its best, use a .png file with a transparent background. GIF, PNG and JPEG formats are supported.

MAX_UI_JOB_EVENTS.title: Max Job Events Retrieved by UI
MAX_UI_JOB_EVENTS.description: Maximum number of job events for the UI to retrieve within a single request.

UI_LIVE_UPDATES_ENABLED.title: Enable Live Updates in the UI
UI_LIVE_UPDATES_ENABLED.description: If disabled, the page will not refresh when events are received. Reloading the page will be required to get the latest details.

SourceEnum.description:
* `azure_rm` - Microsoft Azure Resource Manager
* `controller` - Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform
* `ec2` - Amazon EC2
* `gce` - Google Compute Engine
* `insights` - Red Hat Insights
* `openshift_virtualization` - OpenShift Virtualization
* `openstack` - OpenStack
* `rhv` - Red Hat Virtualization
* `satellite6` - Red Hat Satellite 6
* `terraform` - Terraform State
* `vmware` - VMware vCenter
* `scm` - Sourced from a Project
* `constructed` - Template additional groups and hostvars at runtime

Status602Enum.description:
* `new` - New
* `pending` - Pending
* `waiting` - Waiting
* `running` - Running
* `successful` - Successful
* `failed` - Failed
* `error` - Error
* `canceled` - Canceled

StatusB38Enum.description:
* `new` - New
* `pending` - Pending
* `waiting` - Waiting
* `running` - Running
* `successful` - Successful
* `failed` - Failed
* `error` - Error
* `canceled` - Canceled
* `never updated` - Never Updated
* `ok` - OK
* `missing` - Missing
* `none` - No External Source
* `updating` - Updating
